subject: Marketing
title: The 80/20 Rule of Headlines
description: One-minute skill: The 80/20 Rule of Headlines.

hook.text: 80% of people read the headline. Only 20% read the rest. The headline is the ad for the ad.

buildup.text: David Ogilvy said you spend 80 cents of your dollar on the headline alone.

discovery.text: A headline must promise a benefit, spark curiosity, or threaten a loss to earn the click.

twist.text: Changing just the headline can double or triple conversion rates with zero other changes.

climax.text: The greatest copy in the world is worthless if the headline doesn't pull readers in first.

punchline.text: Win the headline or lose the reader.

quiz.question: According to the 80/20 rule, what percentage reads beyond the headline?
